sub_title: Experienced Senior Software Developer ✔ Technology Enthusiast ✔  Six-String Player ♫  Read on! ☞
summary:
Experienced Senior Developer with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry. Skilled in Java Enterprise 7, Java 8, Spring Suite, Oracle DB, PostgreSQL, Neo4j, Angular 5+, JSF, Java Script and HTML. Passionate about Scala, Functional Programming and Node.js. Strong engineering professional with a Project Manager Diploma focused in PMI Project Management from CODECS University.
In my spare time I enjoy developing mobile apps with Flutter 3 and developing games with Unity3D and Phaser3 with HTML5 for both iOS and Android.

awards.title: Certificate of Excellence

His training delivery has always been a great help for our customers and has allowed PTC to provide a service, that without his support, would not have been possible. In addition to Solutions Centres in Romania and US, he has been a trusted advisor to the larger ThingWorx community by answering questions, providing advice and producing reusable extensions for all.

Core values ☛ Customer Success, Innovation & Empowerment, Integrity & Professionalism, Social Responsibility through Shared Value, Teamwork
Core competencies ☛ Action Oriented, Drive for Results, Integrity & Trust
       
✔ Stefan took on the role of Solution Architect even if he was a Technical Consultant. With leadership and high motivation, he created the ThingWorx framework solution for the project. He is also working on the best practices for developing ThingWorx applications and shares them with the PTC Community. Stefan is pragmatic and has a clear approach to the solution design. As a program manager I noticed his ability to innovate and his commitment for having his projects successful.

profile_positions.description:
In my capacity as an independent contractor, I am currently engaged with Eurocontrol MUAC for the second time, working on the pivotal Man Power Suite (MPS) project. This project holds immense significance for MUAC's operational activities, as it encompasses the creation and maintenance of shift and duty rosters for both operational and technical personnel. With the project on the verge of releasing its first production version, I am proud to be part of a highly competent team where I can leverage my nearly two decades of experience in software development.

Responsibilities / Achievements :

* Collaborating closely with a talented and experienced team, I contribute my extensive full-stack expertise to the Man Power Suite (MPS) project.
* Engaging in all aspects of the development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and analysis to design, implementation, testing, and deployment.
* Working closely with key stakeholders, including operational and technical personnel, to understand their rostering needs and translate them into efficient and user-friendly software solutions.
* Leveraging my in-depth knowledge of Java, Spring Boot, and Angular libraries to architect, develop, and maintain robust and scalable web applications that power the Man Power Suite.
* Staying up to date with the latest technologies and tools, ensuring that the project's dependencies are current, enabling the team to leverage cutting-edge capabilities.
* Conducting thorough testing, debugging, and performance optimization to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet Eurocontrol MUAC's stringent standards.
* Participating actively in code reviews, providing constructive feedback and ensuring adherence to best practices and coding standards.
* Demonstrating strong problem-solving skills to address any technical challenges encountered during development and deployment.
* Contributing to documentation and providing technical support to facilitate smooth knowledge transfer and user adoption.
profile_positions.title: Independent Software Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Part of the Oxygen team that handles customer data and customer consent choices.
Our products are a very central part of the bol.com e-commerce platform. We cater for most other products and teams, inside and outside of our company, that need access to customer data.
We are a mostly backend team and we are running several services built with Spring Boot 2.6 and with code written using java while migrating to kotlin.
For code versioning we are using GitLab that also provides CI/CD pipelines for solution deployment. The deployment ends up in Google Cloud with Kubernetes, BigQuery, CloudStorage and many other services like MemoryStore(Redis) for cache management.
Our main database is PostgreSQL and we started using Locust as a load test platform.
We are following the Agile approach and we are working in sprints of 2 weeks. We use Jira as scrum management tool and bug tracking.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Introduce new work methodologies that adhere to Software Development standards
Design new systems and new architectures as part of the old infrastructure modernization
Integrate multiple systems in order to provide the stakeholders with a clear picture of the current state of the factory
Mentor team members to achieve knowledge transfer, clean code and architecture and platform assimilation
Update and refactor existing code and tools
Rewrite decentralized tools to modern centralized applications in platforms like ThingWorx and Windchill (PTC)
Create custom applications using custom code and widgets in the Thingworx (PTC) platform
Customize the Windchill (PTC) platform and administer the Windchill (PTC) servers
Establish communication lines with all stakeholders in order to gather accurate specifications for the old and new internal applications
Collaborate with other departments in order to align features and deadlines
Create comprehensive documentation for all customizations
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
As the world is looking for more efficient ways to manufacture products, the technology of 3D printing is getting more and more popular. At Signify we are pushing the boundaries of this technology by refining the process so that the resulting products meet the quality standards of more traditional production techniques while reducing the time to market from months to days.
https://www.mycreation.lighting.philips.com/en/
My role allows me to be part of this revolutionary shift and to provide the software support to make it possible. Our digital infrastructure allows our clients to design and customize their own luminaires, place an order and received the 3D printed product on their doorstep in a matter of days.
All this is possible by using a modern software backbone that links all the required processes together. The diversity of technologies, languages and frameworks used here provides learning opportunities on daily basis and it is one of the biggest reasons I decided to join my team. In any given day I might implement a new feature in the Spring Boot java backend, update the API with a new REST endpoint, add a new topic to the RabbitMQ instance, tweak the  React GUI, update the Python software that controls the printers while deploying everything to Docker containers with docker compose.
The domain being so vast, here are some of the main technologies used:
Languages: Java 11, Python 3, C#/F#
Frameworks: Spring Boot, .Net
Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, MySQL
Messaging: RabbitMQ
UI: Angular 9, React js
OS: CentOS, Raspbian, Windows
Deployment: Docker
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer 3D Printing

profile_positions.description:
Every year over 10 million flights are flown over the skies of Europe. With this much traffic and a limited number of people to control it, delays are bound to appear. Along with the delays that are felt by both airlines and passengers, other factors like rerouting increase the fuel used and hence the operational cost.
To counter these shortcomings  Eurocontrol decided to intervene by creating a new communication platform that will cater to both Airline Operators and ATCs.
At its core this platform will facilitate free communication between stakeholders while offering a solid base of information gathered from multiple systems. It's expected an increased efficiency, reduced delays, saved fuel and money for years to come.
As part of the small team that started this project  I had the opportunity to be involved in all development stages starting with the conceptual discussions and feature gathering, going through the architectural challenges and integration constraints, working with business analysts while applying UX principles and putting it all together by implementing the first version of the application.
This project is built mostly on the open stack using Java  and JavaScript.
The backend is served by the Spring Boot framework while the front end is written  using Angular5  with Google Material Design components and Bootstrap 4. For persistence the DB of choice is PostgreSQL and for fast development and testing the in-memory H2.
This project offered me the opportunity to research the UX part of things. By using Adobe XD to generate mock templates we were able to iterate quickly through quite a few UI designs and test workflows before any code was even written. This saved us a lot of time.

Technologies used:

Programming languages:
Java 8
Spring Boot
JMS
JUnit
TypeScript
Angular 5
HTML
CSS

Database:
PostgreSQL
H2

Continuous integration:
Jenkins

Static code analysis:
SonarCube

Source Control:
Git with Bitbucket

Collaboration:
Jira, Confluence
profile_positions.title: Contract Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Developer at Endava, I am working on multiple projects for a high profile client in the banking world. 
My day is usually divided between status meetings, client meetings and application development by writing code in Java and javaScript. I mostly focus on backend development but often enough I find myself also in the position of the frontend programmer.
Depending on the project I work as part of a team or take full ownership of the code. I found out that either way the best feeling you can have at work is when you start getting things done and when the TODO list loses entries.
My company takes a modern approach to the organization of teams and work load by implementing the agile methodology. Usually what starts the work day is the Stand Up / Status meeting in which everyone states their progress and their plan for the day. The division of work one level up is done by using sprint.
Regarding the technologies I'm proud to say that I'm using Java 8 features and not just compiling legacy code with Java 8. Because most projects are done from scratch there is enough room to push for the use of modern languages and frameworks like Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Data and Oracle 12g DB on the backend while on the frontend side writing javaScript code with Angular 2, Node.js, Type Script and CSS.

Technologies used: 

Programming:
             Java 8
             Spring Boot
             Spring MVC
             Angular2
             TypeScript
             NodeJs

IDEs:
             IntelliJ Idea
             Oracle SQL Developer

Databases:
            Oracle

Souce Control:
		Git with Gerrit

Collaboration:
		JIRA, Confluence
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer

profile_positions.description:
Design and develop software applications for companies in the telecom area.
My role as a Senior Java Developer was to follow the specifications that came from the client via the Software  Architect and implement the needed functionality using proven technologies and practices so that the application remains coherent. 
I also have participated in sessions of code improvement where newer frameworks and ideas were added to the newer modules of the application. This included REST API used internally and Swagger for Rest API definition and documentation.
My attributions were as a backend as well as a frontend developer.
We were using JEE 7 combined with Oracle 11g database and jsf implementation Prime Faces.
For building local development environments I was using docker packages that started a Jboss 6 server and a virtual image from oracle that was starting the Oracle 11g DB.
For source management I was using again SVN.

Technologies used: 
Programming:
             Java EE 7
             Groovy
             JBoss 6.1
             Eclipse
             Oracle SQL Developer
Databases:
            Oracle XE 11g
Source Control:
	     SVN
profile_positions.title: Software Development Advisor

profile_positions.description:
As a Senior Java Developer for Kalon I was an integral part of the backend team. The company's main focus was the development of an application sweet for the big, franchise driven corporations that activated mostly in the food industry.
We built applications from the ground up and my team was right there starting from the "ground" phase. We were making sure that all the necessary conditions were met and the foundation was there so that the frontend team could present real and useful data to the user.
We worked closely with the DevOps team on one side and the frontend teams on the other side creating the middle ground.
While the process was mainly agile we were also acting as the R&D when the project was asking for such an endeavor. Because of that I got to work with multiple different technologies some of which I hadn't had the chance to work with.
On some projects I worked with Node.js on others I worked with Java 8 and Scala. I got to work with modern and relevant frameworks like Spring Boot, Spring Data, Jersey and Swagger and I got to try new ideas with frameworks like Vert.x . The APIs I was creating were mostly REST APIs and I was getting the work data from databases like Neo4j, H2, PostgreSQL and MongoDB.
I usually was taking part at the client meeting where specifications where gathered and progress was presented.  

Technologies used:
Programming:
Java 8,
Node.js (javascript)
Python
Frameworks:
Spring Boot, Spring Data, Spring Security, Swagger, Jersey
Unit testing:
JUnit
Databases:
Neo4j, MongoDB, PostgreSQL
Web Servers:
Tomcat, Undertow
Versioning and Bug Reporting : GitHub
profile_positions.title: Senior Programmer

profile_positions.description:
As technical consultant I discovered a very dynamic position that allows me to interact with a lot of people, customers as well as internal resources. I also get the best of the two worlds Software and Hardware by working in the IoT realm. For my position I was asked to become proficient in using PTC’s own IoT platform called Thingworx. After reaching the sufficient level of knowledge I was designated trainer for this platform which opened a lot of new opportunities of meeting current or potential clients but also colleagues from all over the world that were eager to learn about Thingworx. I had travelled for teaching purposes in countries like Germany, Finland, Portugal and India.
Another aspect of my job is working on real life projects for direct customers and with this I was able to actively participate to the architectural development as well as the managing side of the project.
One of the most fun parts is coming up with new functionality for the platform extending it in order to meet the customer’s needs. Also IoT offers me the chance to fully use my background by allowing me to work with sensors and electronic boards like Raspberry pi and Arduino.
IoT being such a dynamic environment right now, the technologies I come in contact with are very diverse:
Programming languages: JAVA SE 7/8, JavaScript, C, .Net, Swift(objective C), Python
Servers: Apache Tomcat 7/8
Services and communication protocols: REST, MQTT, SOAP
Diverse databases: Neo4J, DataStax Enterprise, MySQL, PostgreSQL
OS: Windows, Linux, OSX
Boards: Raspberry Pi, Arduino. 
IDE: Eclipse, NetBeans, MS Visual Studio, XCode
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As analyst programmer my job is to contribute to creating specifications according to client needs and also implement and integrate them to an already existing application.
The main client profile is: public institution with a need for a new finance process managing web application.
I was also designated to investigate and to become proficient with BIRT - Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools for integrating and using it as main reporting tool in our financing web-based application.

As main technologies I worked with :
- Spring 2.4
- Struts
- Velocity
- Tomcat
- BIRT 2.6
- Liferay Portal development
- Java EE 1.6 / 1.7
- JavaScript / Dojo
profile_positions.title: Analyst Programmer
